revised_title: Herbert Westren Turnbull: A Pioneering Mathematician and Educator
tldr: Herbert Westren Turnbull was a prominent mathematician and educator who made significant contributions to algebraic research, the history of mathematics, and mathematical education. He is best known for his work on algebraic invariants and concomitants, as well as his efforts to edit the scientific correspondence of Isaac Newton. Turnbull's career spanned several decades, during which he published over sixty original memoirs, textbooks, and historical works, and founded a school of algebraic research at the University of St Andrews.
